document_title: Mitral valve stenosis: Causes, signs, complications and prevention
subsection_content:
The best way to prevent mitral valve stenosis is to prevent rheumatic fever, so when you have a sore throat, see your doctor to find out the cause and effective treatment. Strep throat, if left untreated, will cause rheumatic fever. Fortunately, strep throat is completely treatable if antibiotics are used properly.
Some other methods of disease prevention are recommended such as:
Build a healthy living environment, improve quality of life because diseases often occur in people living in damp, unsanitary environments; Patients need to have regular health check-ups, take or continuously inject antibiotics as prescribed by a cardiologist.; Follow a bland diet and get proper rest, etc.; Use diuretics and low-dose beta-blockers to reduce mild symptoms as prescribed.
Cardiovascular Center, Tam Anh General Hospital brings together a team of leading experts and experienced doctors; Possessing a system of modern machinery and equipment, pioneering in updating and applying new techniques in screening, diagnosing and treating cardiovascular diseases. Thanks to that, many cases of patients are detected early in the early stages, with timely intervention and treatment, preventing dangerous complications from occurring. CARDIOVASCULAR CENTER, TAM ANH GENERAL HOSPITAL Hanoi:  Address: 108 Hoang Nhu Tiep, Bo De Ward, Long Bien District, City. Hanoi Hotline: 024 3872 3872 – 024 7106 6858 Ho Chi Minh City: Address: 2B Pho Quang, Ward 2, Tan Binh District, Ho Chi Minh City Hotline: 0287 102 6789 – 093 180 6858 Fanpage: https://www.facebook .com/benhvientamanh
Doctor II Tran Thi Thanh Truc emphasized that when you or a family member has mitral valve stenosis, whether you have had surgery or not, the most important thing is to intervene so that the disease does not progress to more dangerous complications. . At the same time, each person should proactively prevent the disease so that dangerous complications do not occur in the future.
